item.title: EUSOME
item.description:
Role: Principal Investigator (PI) for ISI/Athena RC. Funding: >800k€ (Horizon Europe).

The EUSOME project establishes a “Living Lab” for Advanced Aerial Mobility (AAM). We focus on:

  1. Cooperative Sensing: Algorithms for UAV swarms to sense the environment collectively.
  2. Digital Twins: Real-time synchronization between physical drones and their digital counterparts.
  3. Experimental Validation: Using the Aerial Networks Testbed at ISI.

This project bridges the gap between theoretical 6G control algorithms and real-world deployment.

item.title: FIRA-DAV
item.description:
Role: Principal Investigator (PI). Funding: Athena RC Internal PoC (10k€).

We developed a prototype database containing synchronized mmWave Radar (TI IWR6843) and Camera data. This dataset is used to train Deep Unfolding networks and other Scientific ML models for:

  • Object detection in adverse weather.
  • Sensor fusion for autonomous navigation.
  • [cite_start]Training lightweight AI models for embedded deployment[cite: 123].

item.title: SPLASH
item.description:
Role: Principal Investigator (PI). Partner: Hellenic U-Space Industry (HUSI).

SPLASH investigates the Co-design of control and communication protocols for U-Space services. Key innovations include:

  • [cite_start]ISAC Waveforms: Using OTFS/FMCW for simultaneous radar sensing and data transmission[cite: 238].
  • [cite_start]GNSS Resilience: Navigation solutions for GPS-denied environments using cooperative localization[cite: 233].
  • [cite_start]Risk Modeling: New frameworks for UAV swarm safety assessment[cite: 239].
